name: Api
title: Google
Cloud
Translate
Api
description:
Api

Represents top-level access to the Google Cloud Translation API. Translation API supports more than one hundred different languages, from Afrikaans to Zulu. Used in combination, this enables translation between thousands of language pairs. Also, you can send in HTML and receive HTML with translated text back. You donâ€™t need to extract your source text or reassemble the translated content.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/translate"

translate = Google::Cloud::Translate.new

translation = translate.translate "Hello world!", to: "la"

translation.to_s #=> "Salve mundi!"

translation.from #=> "en"
translation.origin #=> "Hello world!"
translation.to #=> "la"
translation.text #=> "Salve mundi!"

methods.name: project_id
title: Google
Cloud
Translate
Api#project_id
methods.description: The Cloud Translation API project connected to.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/translate"

translate = Google::Cloud::Translate.new(
  project_id: "my-todo-project",
  credentials: "/path/to/keyfile.json"
)

translate.project_id #=> "my-todo-project"

methods.name: translate
title: Google
Cloud
Translate
Api#translate
methods.description: Returns text translations from one language to another.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/translate"

translate = Google::Cloud::Translate.new

translation = translate.translate "Hello world!", to: "la"

translation.to_s #=> "Salve mundi!"

translation.detected? #=> true
translation.from #=> "en"
translation.origin #=> "Hello world!"
translation.to #=> "la"
translation.text #=> "Salve mundi!"
translation.model #=> "base"

examples.caption: Using the neural machine translation model:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/translate"

translate = Google::Cloud::Translate.new

translation = translate.translate "Hello world!",
                                  to: "la", model: "nmt"

translation.to_s #=> "Salve mundi!"
translation.model #=> "nmt"

examples.caption: Setting the from language.
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/translate"

translate = Google::Cloud::Translate.new

translation = translate.translate "Hello world!",
                                  from: :en, to: :la
translation.detected? #=> false
translation.text #=> "Salve mundi!"

examples.caption: Retrieving multiple translations.
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/translate"

translate = Google::Cloud::Translate.new

translations = translate.translate "Hello my friend.",
                                   "See you soon.",
                                   from: "en", to: "la"
translations.count #=> 2
translations[0].text #=> "Salve amice."
translations[1].text #=> "Vide te mox."

examples.caption: Preserving HTML tags.
examples.code: require "google/cloud/translate" translate = Google::Cloud::Translate.new translation = translate.translate "Hello world!", to: :la translation.text #=> "Salve mundi!"

params.name: text
params.description: The text or texts to translate.

params.name: to
params.description: The target language into which the text should be translated. This is required. The value must be an ISO 639-1 language code.

params.name: from
params.description: The source language of the text or texts. This is an ISO 639-1 language code. This is optional.

params.name: format
params.description: The format of the text. Possible values include :text and :html. This is optional. The Translation API default is :html.

params.name: model
params.description:
The model used by the service to perform the translation. Can be either base to use the Phrase-Based Machine Translation (PBMT) model, or nmt to use the Neural Machine Translation (NMT) model. The default is nmt.

If the model is nmt, and the requested language translation pair is not supported for the NMT model, then the request is translated using the PBMT model.

params.name: cid
params.description:
The customization id for translate. This is
optional.

returns.description: A single Translation object if just one text was given, or an array of Translation objects if multiple texts were given.

methods.name: detect
title: Google
Cloud
Translate
Api#detect
methods.description: Detect the most likely language or languages of a text or multiple texts.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/translate"

translate = Google::Cloud::Translate.new

detection = translate.detect "Hello world!"
detection.language #=> "en"
detection.confidence #=> 0.7100697

examples.caption: Detecting multiple texts.
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/translate"

translate = Google::Cloud::Translate.new

detections = translate.detect "Hello world!",
                              "Bonjour le monde!"
detections.count #=> 2
detections.first.language #=> "en"
detections.first.confidence #=> 0.7100697
detections.last.language #=> "fr"
detections.last.confidence #=> 0.40440267

params.name: text
params.description:
The text or texts upon which language detection
should be performed.

returns.description: A single Detection object if just one text was given, or an array of Detection objects if multiple texts were given.

methods.name: languages
title: Google
Cloud
Translate
Api#languages
methods.description: List the languages supported by the API. These are the languages to and from which text can be translated.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/translate"

translate = Google::Cloud::Translate.new

languages = translate.languages
languages.count #=> 104

english = languages.detect { |l| l.code == "en" }
english.name #=> nil

examples.caption: Get all languages with their names in French.
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/translate"

translate = Google::Cloud::Translate.new

languages = translate.languages "fr"
languages.count #=> 104

english = languages.detect { |l| l.code == "en" }
english.name #=> "Anglais"

params.name: language
params.description: The language and collation in which the names of the languages are returned. If this is nil then no names are returned.

returns.description: An array of Language objects supported by the API.
